qas.question: What are private secondary schools in Germany called?
What types of schools are most ergänzungsschulen?
Along with private individuals and organizations, what groups sometimes runs ergänzungsschulen?
What are public schools called in Germany?
What are most public schools not a part of?
What do public schools operate outside of in Germany?

plausible_answers.text: in whole by charging their students tuition fees

qas.question: What group will rarely run a public school?

context: <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b4_0>Ergänzungsschulen<b4_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> are <a1_1>secondary or post-secondary<a1_1/> (non-tertiary) schools, which are run by private individuals, private organizations or rarely, <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>religious<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_0/> groups<a3_1/> and offer a type of education which is not available at public schools. Most of these schools are <a1_0><a1_2>vocational<a1_0/> schools<a1_2/>. However, these vocational schools are not part of <b5_0>the German dual education system<b5_0/>. Ergänzungsschulen have the freedom to operate outside of <b6_0>government regulation<b6_0/> and are funded <b7_0>in whole by charging their students <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>tuition<a2_1/><a2_0/> fees<b7_0/><a2_2/>.
